results.title: Le Rouge et le Noir (Episode 2) = the Red and the Black
results.brief_description:
Julien Sorel continues his efforts to climb into high society in mid-nineteenth century France.

Credits: Producer, Louis Wipf ; director, Claude Autant-Lara ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Rene Cloerec ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Gerard Philipe, Danielle Darrieux, Jean Martinelli, Antonella Lualdi, Antoine Balpetre, Jean Mercure, Georges Descrieres.

results.title: Quai des Orfevres = Jenny Lamour
results.brief_description:
On Christmas night, Inspecteur Antoine is asked to investigate the murder of Brignon, an old, creepy producer. The prime suspects are Jenny Lamour, a music-hall singer and Maurice, her jealous husband. Although Jenny knows Maurice’s jealousy is a major hindrance to her career, she fights to have him cleared of all suspicions, until she realises that Antoine is trying to get to her through her husband. The crime-thriller aspect of the film is only a vehicle. What really interests Clouzot is the detailed rendition of the atmospheres of a music-hall and a police station, as well as the quirky characters that populate them. Awards: Venice Film Festival 1947 - Best Direction for Henri-Georges Clouzot.

Credits: Producer, Louis Wipf ; director, Henri-Georges Clouzot ; writers, Henri-Georges Clouzot, Jean Ferry ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Francis Lopez, Albert Lasry ; art direction, Max Douy ; sound, William-Robert Sivel ; costumes, Jacques
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Simone Renant, Bernard Blier, Suzy Delair, Pierre Larquey, Charles Dullin, Robert Dalban, Charles Blavette, Jeanne Fusier-Gir, Gilberte Geniat, Raymond Bussieres, Annette Poivre, Rene Blancard.

results.title: Le Rouge et le Noir (Episode 1) = the Red and the Black
results.brief_description:
Julien Sorel, a carpenter’s son, becomes the tutor of Madame de Renal’s children thanks to the intervention of Abbot Chelan. Soon after he becomes Madame de Renal’s lover. Remorsefully, she puts an end to their affair. Julien leaves his employement to become the secretary of the Marquis de la Mole. The Marquis’ daughter, Mathilde falls for Julien and soon wedding preparations are underway.

Credits: Producer, Louis Wipf ; director, Claude Autant-Lara ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Rene Cloerec ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Gerard Philipe, Danielle Darrieux, Jean Martinelli, Antonella Lualdi, Antoine Balpetre, Jean Mercure, Georges Descrieres.

results.title: La Modification = the Modification
results.brief_description:
A husband recalls his past experiences as he travels by train to Rome from Paris. He has just left his wife for his mistress and flashbacks are employed to tell his story. He thinks of his future in Rome with his mistress as he fondly remembers the highpoints of his mariage.

Credits: Producer, Rene Thevenet ; director, Michel Worms ; writers, Michel Worms, Raphael Cluzel ; photography, Daniel Vogel ; music, Francis Lai.
Cast: Emmanuelle Riva, Maurice Ronet, Silva Koscina, Luis Massoli, Bernard Jeantet, Philippe Chauveau [narration].

results.title: Comptes a Rebours = Reckoning Against the Grain
results.brief_description:
Nolan was set up to take the fall for a crime committed by his whole gang. As a result, his brother is dead and he is forced to do a stint in prison. Nolan comes out of prison looking for his former accomplice, and not just to shake their hands. He runs into an old girlfriend, Madeleine, now a respectable doctor’s wife.

Credits: Producer, Eugene Lepicier ; director, Roger Pigaut ; writers, Andre G. Brunelin, Roger Pigaut ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Serge Reggiani, Jeanne Moreau, Michel Bouquet, Simone Signoret, Marcel Bozzuffi, Charles Vanel.

results.title: Cadet Rousselle
results.brief_description:
In love with the mayor’s daughter, Cadet-Rousselle is separated from his love by money and by low-born parentage. Thus, he heads to Paris to find fame and fortune and make himself worthy of his sweetheart. En route Cadet-Rousselle gets mixed up with a band of gypsies who plan to help the Royalists topple the new French Republic. Adventure piles upon adventure as Rousselle narrowly escapes death at every turn. With him all the way is the new love of his life, fiery gypsy lass Violetta.

Credits: Producer, Rene Bezard ; director, Andre Hunebelle ; writers, Jean Halain, Jean-Paul Lacroix ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; music, Jean Marion.
Cast: Francois Perier, Dany Robin, Bourvil, Christine Carrere, Madeleine Lebeau, Alfred Adam, Jacques Dufilho.

results.title: La Morte Saison des Amours = the Season for Love
results.brief_description:
Sylvain, a writer suffering from writer’s block, and Genevieve, his young bride witness their love for each other die slowly. But, one day, they befriend Jacques, a politician, and his wife, Francoise, a rather modern and liberated couple.

Credits: Producer, Clara d’Ovar ; director, Pierre Kast ; writers, Alain Aptekman, Pierre Kast ; photography, Sacha Vierny ; music, Georges Delerue ; art direction, Jacques Saulnier ; editor, Yannick Bellon.
Cast: Pierre Vaneck, Francoise Arnoul, Daniel Gelin, Francoise Prevost, Michele Verez.

results.title: L'or du Duc = the Duke's Gold
results.brief_description:
Adhemar, Rajah of Kashmir decides to play a nasty trick on his estranged relatives and disinherit them all … except for Ludovic, a vague nephew. Ludovic is a hopeless dreamer and gambler, up to his neck in debts and unpaid tax bills who has to support a wife and ten children. The inheritance arrives in the form of a double-decker bus in which the family promptly moves in order to avoid creditors and gendarmes. For the family, the bus is a wonderful toy which allows them to visit Paris and meet with eccentric characters. The bus also attracts the interest of the Rajah’s former servant, for he alone knows that the double-decker is made of pure gold. This is a charming comedy filled with surrealistic moments and songs.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Kalfon ; director, Jacques Baratier ; writers, jacques Baratier, Eric Ollivier ; photography, Henri Raichi ; music, Michel colombier, Charles Trenet, Robert Rocca ; assistant director, Paul Vecchiali.
Cast: Pierre Brasseur, Jacques Dufilho, Claude Rich, Mony Tarbes, Christian Marin, Jacques Jouanneau, Annie Cordy, Jean Richard, Daniel Emilfork, Daniele Darrieux, Pierre Rep, Noel Roquevert.

results.title: Martin Roumagnac = the Room Upstairs
results.creator_credit: Georges Lacombe and Marc Le Pelletier
results.brief_description:
Martin, a builder in a dusty French provincial town, is hired to construct a house for Blanche, a sophisticated, cosmopolitan newcomer to the district. They have a passionate affair until he discovers that she is a high-class whore, whereupon he kills her and is tried for murder. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producer, Marc Le Pelletier ; director, Georges Lacombe ; writers, Georges Lacombe, Pierre Very ; photography, Roger Hubert ; music, Marcel Mirouze ; art director, Georges Wakhevitch.
Cast: Marlene Dietrich, Jean Gabin, Margo Lion, Lucien Nat, Daniel Gelin.

results.title: Lily Aime Moi = Lily, Love Me
results.brief_description:
Francois, a journalist, is ordered to write an article on the life of a working class man. This is how he meets Claude who has just been abandoned by his wife, Lily. Francois decide to put his job on the side and attempts to help Claude mend his relationship with Lily. The film follows for three days the adventures of two men who were never meant to meet while brushing a warm and ironic portrait of friendships, complicity and relationships.

Credits: Producer, Michel Seydoux ; director, Maurice Dugowson ; writer, Michel Vianey ; photography, Andre Diot ; music, Edgardo Canton.
Cast: Rufus, Jean-Michel Folon, Patrick Dewaere, Zouzou, Roland Dubillard, Juliette Creco, Andreas Voutsinas, Tatiana Moukhine, Roger Blin, Miou-Miou, Henry Jaglom.
